title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 21 § 2188.1 - Introduction
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 21 § 2188.1 - Introduction

State Regulations
(a) This qualified
allocation plan (plan or QAP) is adopted by the New York State Housing Finance

Agency (agency or HFA) pursuant to section 42 of the Internal Revenue Code of
1986, as amended (IRC), and the Treasury Regulations, Revenue Rulings and

Procedures, and other publications of the Internal Revenue Service (service or
IRS) with binding authority applicable thereunder (collectively, the Code), to
govern the allocation or allowance by the agency of any Low-Income Housing Tax

Credit (LIHTC) under IRC section 42. This plan shall apply to: (1)
the allowance by the agency of LIHTC to
projects financed by obligations subject to the private activity bond cap, the
interest on which is exempt from Federal income tax, as provided in IRC section
42(h)(4); and
(2)
any allocation of
LIHTC to the agency by a sub-allocating agency designated by the New York State

Division of Housing and Community Renewal (division) under authority granted by

Part 2040 of Title 9 of the New York Codes, Rules and Regulations. In addition, pursuant to IRC section 42(m)(1)(B)(iii) and treasury regulation 1.42-5, this
plan provides certain procedures that the agency shall follow in monitoring for
noncompliance with the Code and for notifying the IRS thereof. (b) HFA is generally involved in
two kinds of LIHTC projects: (1)
projects
receiving tax exempt bond financing from the agency; or
(2)
projects receiving tax exempt bond
financing from another issuer, subject to the private activity bond volume cap
provisions contained in section 146 of the Code, and accordingly may be
eligible for so called "Private Activity Bond Credits", or "4 percent Credit"
if the project complies with the applicable requirements of this QAP and/or any
additional agency guidance, which may include a pertinent Term Sheet. (c) The agency does not currently
receive any sub-allocation of LIHTC from the division's annual State Credit

Ceiling and therefore does not expect to allocate any such 9 percent Credit. In
the event that the agency receives a sub-allocation of 9 percent Credit, HFA
will allocate the credits pursuant to the definitions, processes, procedures
and requirements in Part 2040 of Title 9 of the New York Official Compilation
of Codes, Rules and Regulations which is available on the agency's website
https://hcr.ny.gov/. (d) The agency may also be involved with
other programs or projects pursuant to this QAP in accordance with Federal or

State mandates. Notes
